CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1944, pg. 13, reads: "Fans Mob Hamp's Thrush - Here is a typical scene of the reception accorded Alice Lindsay, Lionel Hampton's new vocalist, in Columbus, Ohio, during the band's engagement at the Palace Theatre. Alice and Hamp smile for the lensman as youthful admirers swarm around them for autographs.  On the left is Alice's sister, Mrs. Rosalind Eskridge.  in foreground is Mrs. Lionel Hampton...  Alice received rave notices from newspaper, reviewers, and she is already being hailed as star material. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men, including Rosalind Lindsay Eskridge on left, Gladys Hampton squatting in center, Lionel Hampton wearing bow tie, and Alice or Alyce Lindsay wearing suit and hat in center, posed in interior, possibly Columbus, Ohio
